title: Ticket #7273: Remove unnecessary 3-second sleep when DAGMan starts
description:
Right after starting DAGMan sleeps for 3 seconds, supposedly to ensure the process has a unique ID. The reasoning behind this was that if the system process IDs had rolled over, this new condor_dagman instance could collide with a lock file (using the same PID) that had been created previously.

However the only way this collision could actually happen is if a dagman crashes, then the underlying system rolls over 30,000 PIDs in less than a second and tries starting a new condor_dagman process that collides with both original PID and birthday. This is effectively impossible, so we're going to remove the 3-second sleep.
